subject: Why to use JUnits?
msgSnippet: Why do we need to use JUnits? If we have to test any new class, we could create a new class, inside that class we could declare a main() method and call the
messageBody:
Why do we need to use JUnits?
If we have to test any new class, we could create a new class, inside that class we could declare a main() method and call the function to be tested with the required arguments.
Does using JUnits provide any extra feature or additional functionality over this way of testing,i.e, declaring main() methods and testing?
